If {{c|*this}} contains an unexpected value, invokes {{c|f}} with the unexpected value of {{c|*this}} as the argument and returns a {{tt|std::expected}} object that contains an unexpected value, which is initialized with the result of {{c|f}}. Otherwise, returns a {{tt|std::expected}} object that represents an expected value.
@1-4@ The expected value is initialized with the expected value {{rlpi|/#Data members|val}} of {{c|*this}}.

Given type {{tt|G}} as:
@1,2@ {{c/core|std::remove_cv_t&lt;std::invoke_result_t&lt;F, decltype(error())&gt;&gt;}}
@3,4@ {{c/core|std::remove_cv_t&lt;std::invoke_result_t&lt;F, decltype(std::move(error()))&gt;&gt;}}
@5,6@ {{c/core|std::remove_cv_t&lt;std::invoke_result_t&lt;F, decltype(error())&gt;&gt;}}
@7,8@ {{c/core|std::remove_cv_t&lt;std::invoke_result_t&lt;F, decltype(std::move(error()))&gt;&gt;}}

If any of the following conditions is satisfied, the program is ill-formed:
* {{tt|G}} is not a valid template argument for {{rlpt|unexpected|std::unexpected}}.
* The following corresponding declaration is ill-formed:
:@1,2@ {{c|G g(std::invoke(std::forward&lt;F&gt;(f), error()));}}
:@3,4@ {{c|G g(std::invoke(std::forward&lt;F&gt;(f), std::move(error()));}}
:@5,6@ {{c|G g(std::invoke(std::forward&lt;F&gt;(f), error()));}}
:@7,8@ {{c|G g(std::invoke(std::forward&lt;F&gt;(f), std::move(error()));}}


@1,2@ {{cpp/enable if|{{box|{{c/core|std::is_constructible_v&lt;T, decltype((}}{{tti|val}}{{c/core|))&gt;}}}} is {{c|true}}}}.

@3,4@ {{cpp/enable if|{{box|{{c/core|std::is_constructible_v&lt;T, decltype(std::move(}}{{tti|val}}{{c/core|))&gt;}}}} is {{c|true}}}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|f|a suitable function or {{named req|Callable}} object whose call signature returns a non-reference type}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Given expression {{c|expr}} as:
@1,2@ {{c|std::invoke(std::forward&lt;F&gt;(f), error())}}
@3,4@ {{c|std::invoke(std::forward&lt;F&gt;(f), std::move(error()))}}
@5,6@ {{c|std::invoke(std::forward&lt;F&gt;(f), error())}}
@7,8@ {{c|std::invoke(std::forward&lt;F&gt;(f), std::move(error()))}}

The return values are defined as follows:
